org.locationtech.geowave.core.store.adapter.statistics.histogram

Class MinimalBinDistanceHistogram

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.locationtech.geowave.core.store.adapter.statistics.histogram.MinimalBinDistanceHistogram
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    NumericHistogram

    public class MinimalBinDistanceHistogram
extends Object
implements NumericHistogram
    Dynamic Histogram:

    Derived from work for Hive and based on Yael Ben-Haim and Elad Tom-Tov, "A streaming parallel decision tree algorithm", J. Machine Learning Research 11 (2010), pp. 849--872.

    Note: the paper refers to a bins as a pair (p,m) where p = lower bound and m = count. Some of the interpolation treats the pair as a coordinate.

    Although there are no approximation guarantees, it appears to work well with adequate data and a large number of histogram bins.

      • add

        public void add(double v)
        Adds a new data point to the histogram approximation. Make sure you have called either allocate() or merge() first. This method implements Algorithm #1 from Ben-Haim and Tom-Tov, "A Streaming Parallel Decision Tree Algorithm", JMLR 2010.
        Specified by:
        add in interface NumericHistogram
        Parameters:

        public double quantile(double q)
        Gets an approximate quantile value from the current histogram. Some popular quantiles are 0.5 (median), 0.95, and 0.98.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
